newsitem.title: JAPAN: Softbank shares extend gains in afternoon.
newsitem.headline: Softbank shares extend gains in afternoon.

text.p: Shares in Softbank Corp extended recent gains on Wednesday, rising above 11,500 yen for the first time since October on market expectations that the firm will post good earnings for 1996/97, brokers said.
At 0503 GMT, Softbank shares were being traded at 11,600 yen, compared with their Monday close of 10,600 yen.
Turnover in the computer software and publishing firm was 525,300 as of 0505 GMT, the second-biggest on the over-the-counter market.

"There is growing speculation that the company's business results for the year to March 1997 will be better than the market has expected. Also, likely participation by Sony Corp in Japanese satellite broadcasting venture is taken as a positive factor," a trader at a foreign brokerage said.
Sony has shown an interest in taking a stake in Japan Sky Broadcasting Co, or JSkyB, a satellite broadcasting venture owned by Australia's News Corp and Softbank.
